result.execSummary:
All charges against Cody Thomas Williams in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody Thomas Williams is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Thomas Williams

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM Defendant Cody Thomas Williams in court with attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 20CM248, 21CF22, 21cf88, 21CM41, 21TR19, 22CF27, 22cf57. ADA Walker: amended information in 21CF22. Guilty to Ct#2 in 20CM248- 2 years probation- court costs, restitution $373.67 plus 10% surcharge, 2 day credit. guilty to Ct#2,6,7,9 in 21CF22- 3 years probation on Ct#2- court costs, 2 years probation on Ct#7- $443 and restitution of $2140.99 plus 10% surcharge. 1 year probation on amended Ct#9- 15 days jail, all but 5 days stayed, $1555 fine, 12 months revocation of DL and IID, $75 costs for PCSO,Ct #5 in 21cf22 5 days jail and court costs. guilty to Ct#5 in 21CF88 2 years probation- court costs and 2 days credit. guilty to Ct#3 in 22CF27- 2 years probation- court costs 1 day credit. All cases; concurrent. DISMISS: Ct#1,3,4 in 20CM248, Ct#1,3-5,8,10-11, Ct#1-4, 6 in 21CF88, 21CM41, 21tr119, and Ct#1-2, 4-5 in 22cf27.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 20CM248, Ct#2,6,7, amended #9 in 21CF22, Ct#5 in 21CF88 and Ct#3 in 22cf27. Counsel stipulates to factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 20CM248, Ct#2,6,7,9 in 21CF22, Ct#5 in 21CF88 and Ct#3 in 22cf27.DISMISS: Ct#1,3,4 in 20CM248, Ct#1,3-5,8,10-11, Ct#1-4, 6 in 21CF88, 21CM41, 21tr119, and Ct#1-2, 4-5 in 22CF27. ADA Walker addresses sentencing; requesting cash bond on cases be applied to restitution. Atty Erdman addresses sentencing. Defendant addresses court. 

Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#2 in 20CM248- court costs ($443) restitution $373.67 plus 10% surcharge,   comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 2 days credit if probation is revoked.
Court orders on Ct#6 in 21CF22- court costs ($443) 2 years to pay and 5 days jail; concurren to Ct#9. Defendant will report on May 2, 2022 at 8am. Good time. 
Court orders S/W 3 years probation on Ct#2 in 21CF22- court costs ($518) , 2 years probation on Ct#7- court costs ($443), restitution $250 (victim) and $2890.99 (insurance) plus 10% surcharge, 1 year probation on amended Ct#9- 15 days jail, all but 5 days stayed, Defendant to report May 2, 2022 at 8 am- good time. , $1555 fine, 12 months revocation of DL and IID, $75 costs for PSCO.  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#5 in 21CF88- court costs ($443)  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 2 days credit if probation is revoked. DNA sample on all cases. All probations are concurrent to each other and any other probationary sentence
Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#3 in 22cf27- court costs ($443).  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.1 day credit.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court adjourned at 4:21 pm.

4:13 pm Cody T. Williams appears in Court, Atty Michelle Erdman appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State. Waive the PH. Court questions/reviews DE's rights.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

Atty Erdman and DE will waive the PH. Court reviews/questions DE.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to possess or consume alcohol.
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH J.A.W. OR C.A.W.

3:14 PM Defendant Cody Thomas Williams appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DE does qualify for PD. DA Hatch is requesting a $1,000.00 CBS w/conditions of AS & Not to possess/consume Alcohol, NC w/J.A.W. or C.A.W., objection. Court orders a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions requested, Cash bond could be set w/any new charges. Court adjourned at 3:27 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
